title: American Federation of Actors
text: The American Federation of Actors (AFA) was an early <a href="actor">actor</a>s <a href="labor%20union">union</a> in the United States. It was supported by <a href="Sophie%20Tucker">Sophie Tucker</a> who was elected as the union's president in 1938. In 1939, the AFA was disbanded by the <a href="American%20Federation%20of%20Labor">American Federation of Labor</a> for financial mismanagement. The AFL subsequently issued a charter to the succeeding <a href="American%20Guild%20of%20Variety%20Artists">American Guild of Variety Artists</a>, with some AFA members joining the <a href="Actors%27%20Equity%20Association">Actors' Equity Association</a>.
